library.title: The Seas Will Save Us
library.author: Bren Smith
library.blurb: I’m a fisherman who dropped out of high school in 1986 at the age of 14. Over my lifetime, I’ve spent many nights in jail. I’m an epileptic. I’m asthmatic. I don’t even know how to swim. This is my story. It’s a story of ecological redemption.

library.title: Acid Trap
library.author: Peter Brannen
library.blurb: Earth’s oceans are beginning to warm and turn acidic, endangering plankton and the entire marine food chain

library.title: Everest at the Bottom of the Sea
library.author: Bucky McMahon
library.blurb: When the ocean liner Andrea Doria sank south of Cape Cod, she took fifty-one with her. Since then she's taken twelve more, five in the last two summers alone. On this very day, a man is strapping on two hundred pounds of scuba gear to make the descent, to bring back a little souvenir from the boat's gift shop, to possibly never return.

library.title: The Piscavores Dilemma
library.author: Tim Zimmermann
library.blurb: The oceans are in serious trouble, creating a tough question for consumers: Should I eat wild fish, farmed fish, or no fish at all? The author, a longtime student of marine environments, dove into an amazing new world of ethical harvesters, renegade farmers, and problem-solving scientists. The result: your guide to sustainably enjoying nature's finest source of protein.

library.title: The Sailfish
library.author: Tim Ecott
library.blurb: Just after my father died an uncanny diving encounter with a giant sailfish spoke to me of life’s mysterious connections

library.title: The Whale's Return
library.author: Philip Hoare
library.blurb: Ancient yet playful, endangered but resurgent, the North Atlantic right whale is a living reminder of how little we know

library.title: Engineering the ocean
library.author: David Bielo
library.blurb: Once you know what plankton can do, you’ll understand why fertilising the ocean with iron is not such a crazy idea

library.title: The depths of Okeanos
library.author: James Romm
library.blurb: To the ancient Greeks, Ocean – at once a monster and a god – was what the Big Bang is to cosmologists today

library.title: Through a glass, sadly
library.author: Bernd Brunner
library.blurb: The aquarium was once the best way to encounter the wonders of sea life. It has become a mere travesty, tacky and cruel

library.title: The Good Catch
library.author: Megan Molteni
library.blurb: Hope for the world's devastated oceans rests on a change in the hearts of the fishermen that know them best

library.title: Deep Intellect
library.author: Sy Montgomery
library.blurb: The soul of an Octopus. This piece sheds light on how these incredible creatures are helping scientists grasp the extent of animal intelligence and the meaning of consciousness.

library.title: Rethinking extinction
library.author: Stewart Brand
library.blurb: The idea that we are edging up to a mass extinction is not just wrong – it’s a recipe for panic and paralysis

library.title: Saving the World's Oceans Is This Marine Biologist's Life Pursuit
library.author: Gary Strauss
library.blurb: Sylvia Earle, an unstoppable force at 81, wants 20% of Earth's oceans declared protected marine areas by 2020.

library.title: Natural Aquaculture: Can We Save Oceans by Farming Them?
library.author: Richard Schiffman
library.blurb: A small but growing number of entrepreneurs are creating sea-farming operations that cultivate shellfish together with kelp and seaweed, a combination they contend can restore ecosystems and mitigate the impacts of ocean acidification.

library.title: Unfathomable
library.author: James Nestor
library.blurb: Sunken treasure, death defying adventure, sibling rivalry: How Charles and John Deane invented modern deep-sea diving and saved the British Empire.
